item.title: Cowpants
item.description: Today is the day we celebrate Cow Pants.

item.title: Vitamin K as an antidote to rat poison
item.description:
While speaking with the exterminator today, I picked up a nice bit of trivia: Vitamin K is an antidote to Warfarin — aka “rat poison”.

The exterminator asked if there was dog food left out where the rats could get to it. He explained that dog food contains vitamin K, which would neutralize any rat poison he left out.

item.title: Berry Plastics Corp.
item.description: Berry Plastics Corp. makes the monstrous 32oz plastic cups found at QT.

item.title: The Bomber Complex, Inc. – Restaurant, Catering, and B-17G Restoration Project
item.description:
In Milwaukie, OR, someone turned a B-17 Bomber into a gas station/restaurant.

From The Register:

“Milwaukie, Oregon – only in America can you beat a B-17 into a gas station.

Shortly after WWII a guy named Art Lacey (he had a British wife) went to Kansas to buy a surplus B-17. His idea was to fly it back to Oregon, jack it up in the air and make a gas station out of it. He paid $15,000 for it. He asked which one was his and they said take whichever you want because there were miles of them. He didn’t know how to fly a 4 engine airplane so he read the manual while he taxied around by himself. They said he couldn’t take off alone so he put a mannequin in the co-pilot’s seat and off he went.

item.title: Why Ctrl-v for Paste
item.description:
In response to “Why use Ctrl-v for Paste, when Ctrl-p would be more obvious”, the answer is, basically, “Blame Apple, and because it falls into a nice line, along with z, x, and c.”

[ link]

item.title: mossgraffiti
item.description: I’m sure it’s unbelievably nerdy, but I think this mossgraffiti is freakishly cool.

item.title: BEWARE THE DEATH TOWERS!
item.description:
What Are Death Towers?

I saw documentation that showed that Hillary, while she was extracting blood money from Arkansas corporations and perhaps performed her first ritual murder, was also employed as a lawyer by elder Bush in the 1980s to disguise shipments of long range cannons to look like irrigation pipes.

Anything that associates Hillary Clinton with ritual murders, George Bush Sr, and cannons that look like irrigation pipes IN THE FIRST SENTENCE is damn good reading.

item.title: Tree-Top Boulders
item.description:
Spooky.

400-pound boulders in the tops of 80-foot tall trees are spooky.

Hooray for Halloween!

item.title: Diesel Engine
item.description:
Per Rod, this is the most “powerful diesel engine in the world”.

At 108,920 HP, I think it’d make a great replacement for my pool pump.

item.title: Silk Purse
item.description: For the record, it is possible to make a silk purse from a sow‘s ear.
